Author: gleb
Content: My own perception would be also to rank Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, and Benchmark as top 3, but to put KP half-a-step above the other two, and Sequoia marginally above Benchmark.  Especiaually during the last bubble KP really had a reputation of a golden touch in SV, and their startups had an advantage when recruiting. I suspect that people PG surveyed formed their brand perception over longer time than I have.

Author: SwellJoe
Content:
Really nice execution on an idea so boring and obvious that everybody goes "of course there's a site that does that", which is probably the very best kind of idea. Great intro video, too. Everybody on the internet likes cute girls talking to them.

If you manage to get some traction before a dozen imitators spring up, you'll be golden.

Author: moses1400
Title: Silicon Valley Star face-off: Kevin Rose vs. Jason Calacanis vs. Guy

Author: pg
Content: We once funded a company that didn't move. It didn't work very well. A startup would have to be really good to convince us. And if we did agree it would hurt them, relative to what they might have done if they'd moved.

Author: rms
Content: Welcome to the club.   :) You'd get an email if you were on the official blacklist, though.

Author: spiralhead
Content: The TV commercials gave me the impression that Google maps works. That's about as advanced as javascript gets.
